1.text: Clean your hands and work area before making a mask.

2.text: Pick a heavy-weight, tight-woven fabric, such as cotton.

3.text: Print and cut out the CDC-approved pattern.

4.text: Trace the pattern onto your fabric and cut it out.

5.text: Cut two 36 in × 0.5 in (91.4 cm × 1.3 cm) strips of fabric to use for ties.

6.text: Fold the top 0.5 in (1.3 cm) edge of the backside over a fabric tie.

7.text: Sew along the top to secure the fabric strip.

8.text: Insert metal floral wire into the pocket at the top of the mask.

9.text: Make 3 small folds over the center of the mask to create pleats.

10.text: Stitch up the sides of the mask to secure the pleats and wire.

11.text: Fold the bottom 0.5 in (1.3 cm) over the second fabric strip.

12.text: Sew a topstitch around the perimeter of the mask twice to secure it.

13.text: Wash your mask before wearing it.
